context: By 2005, Accenture had established itself as a pure-play consulting firm following its IPO in 2001. The market was focused on enterprise application integration, offshore delivery models, and business process outsourcing. Indian IT services firms were rapidly growing as cost-effective alternatives. The post-Sarbanes-Oxley environment created demand for compliance and risk management consulting.
